question_text: Select two reasons why an organization might use COPE instead of BYOD.
answer_options: To give employees more personal app freedom
To ensure company control over hardware and configuration
To simplify compliance and security management
correct_answer: To ensure company control over hardware and configuration
To simplify compliance and security management
explanation: COPE (Corporate Owned, Personally Enabled) devices are company-owned but allow some personal use, enabling better control and policy enforcement.
